metadata.dc:author: Chillón, S
Papí, M
Espuch, D
Fernández, A J
Talavera, J
metadata.dc:description: The presence of neck metastasis in patients with testicular germ cell neoplasms in a rare but well known phenomenon. The incidence of neck metastasis in testicular carcinoma has been reported to be present in a 5% of cases. When cervical metastasis occurs, surgical resection of the residual disease following chemotherapy and using a specific technique of modified neck dissection results in a surprisingly improvement of the prognosis.
metadata.dc:title: Metástasis cervical de teratoma testicular.
[Cervical metastasis from testicular teratoma].
